entries.meaning: The person or organization to which something, such as a letter or message, is addressed or sent, for whom the item is intended.
(linguistics) A person or entity to whom discourse is directed, or the words referring to such an entity.
examples: Person is a grammatical property which is overtly manifested in so-called Personal Pronouns: forms which include the speaker (I/we) are said to be ‘first personʼ Pronouns; forms which include the addressee (you) and not the speaker are said to be ‘second personʼ Pronouns; while forms which exclude both speaker and addressee (he/she/it/they) are ‘third personʼ Pronouns.
